name: Champurrado Recipe (Express Version)
description: Here's an easy recipe for a delicious Champurrado -- a warm, hearty Mexican chocolate drink that is becoming more and more popular North of the border.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1/3 cup Masa Harina to a saucepan along with 1 cup warm water and a pinch of salt.  Whisk vigorously to prevent lumps from forming.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1/3 cup Masa Harina to a saucepan along with 1 cup warm water and a pinch of salt.  Whisk vigorously to prevent lumps from forming.

recipeInstructions.text: Over medium heat, add 2.5 cups of milk, 1 disc Mexican chocolate, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, and 2 tablespoons brown sugar.  I usually chop up the chocolate into smaller pieces so it melts faster.
recipeInstructions.name: Over medium heat, add 2.5 cups of milk, 1 disc Mexican chocolate, 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, and 2 tablespoons brown sugar.  I usually chop up the chocolate into smaller pieces so it melts faster.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to a simmer and reduce heat to maintain a quiet simmer, whisking frequently.  Once the chocolate has melted take a final taste for seasoning, adding more sugar if you want.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to a simmer and reduce heat to maintain a quiet simmer, whisking frequently.  Once the chocolate has melted take a final taste for seasoning, adding more sugar if you want.

recipeInstructions.text: Keep simmering until you are happy with the consistency.  Serve immediately.
